name: WeFi
overview: WeFi is a wifi software ‘connection tool’ that detects and qualifies local wifi access points.

funding_rounds.source_description: VCs Back WeFi For WiFi Location Network
WeFiâ€™s Directory Nearly 30 Million WiFi Hotspots Strong, Raises More Funding

milestones.description: WeFi extends platform to PCs and Android mobile phones
milestones.source_text:
New features include specific categorization of available Wi-Fi hotspots, user-friendly mapping of all access points relative to a specific street address, and more

Users are able to locate and connect automatically to the best available hotspots, which are qualified by the user community, utilizing an expanding database of over 56 million Wi-Fi access points worldwide

Delaware, USA, April 14, 2010: WeFi Inc. (www.wefi.com), creator of the worldâ€™s largest community-based global Wi-Fi network, launched today an enhanced version of its free software for PC and Android mobile devices. The software, available for free download from www.wefi.com/download/, provides users with automatic access to the best Wi-Fi connection available. WeFiâ€™s updated software utilizes crowdsourcing to drive backend algorithms that provide for superior Wi-Fi intelligence on all details relating to nearby hotspots, enabling a more comprehensive user experience. The enhanced features are further proof of WeFi leading the way in providing quick and automatic Wi-Fi access to users around the world.

Prime features of the updated version of the software include up-to-date, highly detailed information of available hotspots such as the type of location (cafÃ©, library, etc.), whether or not the Wi-Fi access point requires a password, costs money or is free, requires a web homepage sign-in or not, and more. A new â€œFind Wi-Fiâ€ feature enables users to locate qualified hotspots either around their current location â€“ not only within the Wi-Fi reception range of their device, but on the streets around them â€“ or around any desired street address. While Android users will benefit from WeFi using GPS or cell-based location technology to automatically identify nearby hotspots around their current location, users on both PC and Android can also take advantage of â€œFind Wi-Fiâ€ by typing in any desired address (see screenshots for example). A look at the WeFi global map of recorded hotspots â€“ over 56 million to date worldwide â€“ enables WeFiâ€™s more than 4 million users to find hotspots around the globe, locate fellow users online based on their connection location, and map and edit updated information on hotspots near them as well. Users can have their Twitter status automatically updated with a change in WeFi location as well.

The WeFi software provides a high performance, open and global broadband wireless network by combining a community-generated database, a smart connection manager and a dynamic access point/hotspot directory. WeFi always seeks to connect users to Wi-Fi access points where the Internet access has already been verified by other WeFi-enabled devices â€“ dubbed â€œcommunity-verified spotsâ€ â€“ and has a growing network of over 56 million â€œverifiedâ€ access points.

Zur Feldman, CEO of WeFi, said:
â€œMore and more each day, the ability to connect to the Internet quickly and easily is becoming a crucial tool needed to stay informed and interact with friends, family and business partners. The beauty of what WeFi provides to its users is the high-level intelligence that allows them to locate, connect to, and stay connected to the fastest available Wi-Fi hotspot around, no matter where they are. Our newly enhanced software provides a number of upgraded features that gives the user an even greater awareness and control of where and when they want to connect, and serves as further proof of WeFiâ€™s commitment to providing the best Wi-Fi internet experience possible.â€
milestones.source_description: Enhanced WeFi Version Launches on Android Mobile Phones, Bringing Superior Wi-Fi Intelligence
